website_summaries.verdict: Opt for a hook or alternate adhesive to mount this ultra-thin antenna, which picks up signals well when positioned correctly.
pros: Very lightweight and easy to mount on a wall or in a window
With no line of sight obstacles, can pick up HD signals from 35-40 miles away
cons: Included adhesive stickers don’t work well on window glass
Positioning for good reception can be a little frustrating

website_summaries.verdict: The Winegard FlatWave FL-5000 is a paper-thin indoor TV antenna that performs nearly as well as bulkier, more traditional TV antennas and comes with a longer (albeit uglier) cable than the Mohu Leaf.
pros: The Winegard FlatWave FL-5000 Antenna is a flat TV antenna that measures just 0.2 inch thick
It has a black finish on one side and white on the other, and can be positioned either way
And it comes with a 15-foot-long cable, making it easy to position for optimal reception
cons: The FL-5000's permanently attached black cable doesn't look great against white walls, and you're not likely to get great reception unless you put it in a window

customer_reviews.title: The best quality flat antenna!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to some of the bigger named units, this flat, indoor antenna is worth paying a premium for. It gets MUCH better reception, especially when paired with their amplifier. It's not as simple and elegant of a solution with their own amplifier, but it just plain works and gets reception that other units rated with a longer range just won't get.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Trees definitely impact reception
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews of indoor antennas and settled on this one. I researched signal strength from stations and they show that I should have a strong signal from all stations. Unfortunately, we have a lot of trees in our neighborhood. After moving the antenna round to numerous locations in our house we have started finding channels. I had originally posted a terrible review, but since I have found channels I needed to be fair and change my review. The lesson is to be patient and to try and try again until you find channels.
customer_reviews.author: Sala C

customer_reviews.title: Great reception for VHF as well as UHF channels!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it could improve on a different indoor antenna that wasn't reliably picking up VHF channels (notably the Fox and ABC affiliates). We're in LA metro, the Mt Wilson transmitters are about 20 miles away. I swapped the Winegard antenna in for the old antenna and straight out of the box it picked up the Fox affiliate just fine - I didn't even have to pick up the antenna and hunt around for a signal! It also picks up ABC and all the channels the old antenna did. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic antenna. The absolute best I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: Straight to the point: I'm finally able to get all the channels I knew I could get! A fantastic antenna that delivers what it promises. After getting frustrated with several other antennas, I decided to try this one. It took some time to position it the right way, but once you get it, the signal is strong and stable. It's very thin and larger than other models (Which I guess also helps with the reception). As an added bonus, I was able to curve it a bit for improved reception. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Patrix

customer_reviews.title: Great OTA antenna!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic antenna for OTA channels. I had to upgrade from a really cheap antenna to this one after reading a few recommendations on ones that offered VHF and UHF. No complaints here as all of the changes I expected now show up (a few require some adjustments as I installed it fully indoors). It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: So happy cutting the cable!
customer_reviews.text: I get all the major networks plus several of the local channels and a couple of really interesting channels: The Buzzr Network which only shows vintage game shows, some as old as the early 50's! Fascinating to see how people have changed and how game shows have changed over the years. The other is Decades which is a network that focused on historical events one decade at a time, but the really good part is that Decades shows Laugh-In twice a day, every day, and they have the Dick Cavett show where he interviews some of the most important people of his time, an awesome, awesome show. Oh, yeah, antenna works great, easy to place, etc.
customer_reviews.author: thedanester

customer_reviews.title: At 30 miles, excellent UHF reception, no VHF channels picked up
customer_reviews.text: I use this connected to a Samsung Series 7 TV. Channels detected using the TV's scanning feature. Excellent reception on my ~30 mile distant NY UHF channels 2, 4, 5, 9. Poor reception on 50+ mile distant Philly UHF channel 10. VHF channels are not received well enough by this product for my TV's scanner to recognize them at all -- no channels 7 or 11 from NYC.
customer_reviews.author: ML Tross

customer_reviews.title: Saying goodbye to hefty cable
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose! We mostly watch tv through the firestick and Amazon prime. We were very tired of paying the huge Comcast cable bill just to basically watch news occasionally and mostly the fall/winter sports we enjoy. When we heard that prime and possibly Hulu were going to be carrying hockey, SEC and other sports shows we watch, we decided to ditch cable in hopes of this promise. We get 18 channels and have had no trouble whatsoever with bad reception. Clear picture all the time. Now we hope Amazon comes through with its promises.
customer_reviews.author: Just a regular person

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good - High in the Mountains - and 11 Channels to date...
customer_reviews.text: I'm smart - but not too techie. Even I could install one end....ANT IN on back of TV ....and attach the Antenna to a nearby area that looks right out a window towards town Antenna's on the mountainside. I'm high in the mountains, but just outside town. I was sceptical...but happy to even get 11 channels. So Far...I plan on moving the Antenna around the room and see if I can get more. I have an "Air" question vs. "DTV Air" ...I'll ask in the Questions area.
customer_reviews.author: christine-marie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Results with This Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I live in Fort Wayne, IN, about 15 miles from the transmitter towers and when I installed this antenna and did a scan, I found I got 24 strong channels. I was amazed! I have the antenna connected to my 4-tuner Tablo OTA recorder and can view any of the channels on any of my four TVs that are on my WiFi or wired home network. I've not had any problems since I installed the antenna in July 2018.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Blue

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 4 different antennas with different degrees of success. So, when I took this one out of the box my expectations were mixed. I hooked it up and positioned it towards the best coverage and was surprised to see that it picked up more than any of the other (more expensive) antennas. This includes the local NBC affiliate which is on VHF. As everyone should note reception and antennas depend on location and positioning (also weather and sun activity). I recommend reading the directions and looking at the website before purchasing any antenna - the more you know about the signal the better selection you will make.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Finally some channels!
customer_reviews.text: We had been using RCA rabbit ears style antenna from Walmart, we got 4 channels but they kept cutting in and out. Messing with rabbit ears is so frustrating. Bought this Winegard Flat Wave and when installed in a window, we now get 14 channels coming in crystal clear! The first time we scanned for channels it said 4 were found, the second time it said 14 channels! Awesome. Worth every penny. We did not get the amplified one, but this one works great! We live in town but never had luck with other antenna's until this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy77

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very good low price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my neighbor because I have one in my own house and gets used everyday. A very good product and worth every penny. Don't buy others-this company knows what they are doing. Follow the instructions and yours should last as long as your house. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: sg7365

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to cable. We get about 35-45 channels depending on its location. We got it mostly to get the basic channels such as NBC and ABC and those work great, plus some other channels we have never heard of. We use Netflix and hulu to watch other shows and using these we don't miss cable at all. The only complaint is we live by an airport and we loose reception every time a plane flies overhead (To be expected maybe? ). This shouldn't be a problem for most people though, but because of this I give it 4 stars instead of 5. Otherwise this is a great antenna!
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Clear Signals Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I get a nice channel listing from this product. I live on the first floor of a 3 story apartment building so I put it up as high as I can get it. I usually do a channel search once a month per the specs and it actually picked up two additional channels last time. On a really cloudy day (a lot of those in Oregon) I have some reception issues but its not this antennas fault as other channels are in crystal clarity. I really do love this thing and it is a must for cord cutters. Very easy to apply. I just used blue loctite putty to stick it on the wall and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: xayekim

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna overall
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I don't understand this new HD over the air tv thing....but I rarely get all the channels I'm supposed to get, and I'm only 22 miles from the stations downtown. This antenna is well made but a little difficult to aim. It's nice that its flat, but if you need to aim it perpendicular to your wall, you really can't. I'm happy with it....but maybe I need to stop being cheap and spring for cable!
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL, FIXED ALL MY PROBLEMS!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different antennas trying to avoid paying for cable and none could get all the channels clearly. Yes, they were okay, but there was always a channel or two that just wouldn't come through or didn't come through clear enough to keep my hubby from insisting that we get cable. Then I found this jewel! It is a marvel!! The cord is long enough that I was able to put it around the corner from my TV facing the direction suggested by the TV antenna websites, stuck it on the wall, ran a channel search, and voila perfect channels. It is what I have spent two years searching for. I am very HAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: kcherm

customer_reviews.title: Picks up stations 35 miles away with no pixelation
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I live on the 14th floor of my apartment so I do have a height advantage. I used several antennas. rabbit ears, amplified antenna, etc. They worked on some of my stations but got pixelation on most of them. Since installing this antenna on the highest point on my south window I get ABC, CBS, FOX, CW, NBC, CBC (two stations) and 29 independent stations with no pixelation! The CBC stations are in Windsor Ontario Canada 35 miles away! The only stations I don't get from Detroit is WADL because the TV Transmitter is located on 15 mile road, my apartment is on 14 mile road and I'm on the south side. Not complaining, I don't watch WADL anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as indoor antenna.
customer_reviews.text: This works fine with TX transmitters about 8 miles away, with the antenna attached to the inside of a window, facing TXs, about 6 feet above the ground. The picture is sharper than over cable. Looking at the antenna, I do not thing it would last outside.
customer_reviews.author: Corn Cob

customer_reviews.title: Works well, and it's simple to place and move.
customer_reviews.text: Note - this is for the non-amplified version. This antenna is just fantastic. It works in our little, hemmed in townhouse, and despite the warning we have two TV's set up, as well as having the antenna going through a house-wide cable network, and we have not seen any problems. In fact, it's superior to our previous powered Rabbit Ears type of antenna. I suspect the difference is that we can place it up high, on the second floor of our house. Although it's a functional piece of equipment, the simple design and color make it as unobtrusive as something hanging eight feet up on a wall can be. Very, very happy with this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a less expensive "active" antenna, it worked ok but not near like this one. The other reviews regarding good quality is what I also found. Moving the antenna around worked fine and the picture settled down once the antenna stopped moving. I ended up finding 58 digital signals, some better than others but ended up getting all the regular normal channels with great clarity. I plan on getting one more of these for our TV upstairs in the workout room, excellent quality and works great!! Very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Wellman

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T SEE THE CHANNELS FOR THE TREES...
customer_reviews.text: I think this product would be a great idea for inner-city and suburban people who do not live under masses of 200+ year old suburban trees as I do and/or "out in the sticks." A friend in the city raves about the reception he gets with this product; I simply could NOT get any channels to appear and I tried it on all 3 of my HDTVs and tried many configurations with each installation. [SIGH!] I would have rated this product 4 stars, even though it did not work, if Winegard customer service department had been worth a snap: les cretins. I received more assistance from Sanyo than I did with Winegard...bottom line, this product did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: LA-Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Thought I would be able to see more channels
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I have access to the public stations closest to my house. Easy to install. When channels work, they are nice and clear. Cons: I thought I would get more channels being so close to a major city. Sometimes none of the channels really come in clearly and other times only one of the sister channels comes in decent. Bottom line: I can usually see the news but if I could do it again, I'd go the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: theaterminion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video and audio
customer_reviews.text: This Winegard FlatWave antenna works very good. My home is approximately 13 miles from the broadcast towers. I was skeptical at first, but an attic antenna was impractical so I tried the FlatWave FL-5000. By placing the antenna against the wall behind the TV around 36" from floor the signal strength is in the neighborhood of 22 - 24 dB. Video and audio quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but didnt get the channels we were after
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since we have cut the cable and my husband wanted to watch local sports. I was curious to see if it would work. Our tv is about 3 feet from the sliding glass door so I put the antenna on the doorframe and got 30 channels popped up. The local channels we wanted did shpw up but the picture was not the beat and went in and out. We did get some very clear channels but werent the channels we were interested in. Overall we returned it because it wasn't what we were looking for but it does work and you can get alot of channels. So I guess it depends where you are located.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've ditched my cable TV, between using this antenna and Hulu, I"m saving $83 a month. Update: I was previously using an un-amplified version of this same antenna, but since moving I don't have access to a window that points in the correct direction. I thought perhaps the amplified one would work and it does... sort of. I don't think it's the fault of the antenna but now if weather conditions are off, my reception has constant interruptions. Unfortunately I live in an apartment and cannot put anything on the outside of the building. Still searching for a better indoor antenna.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the country
customer_reviews.text: My brother is using this in the Country in Alabama. The picture quality goes from good to great depending on the weather. This antenna has never failed. 90 percent of the time the picture is crystal clear and able to pick up channels from the distance town area.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to turn off the lower quality repeat channels if you are getting the same channel from different broadcasting towers l
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again! It was a little pricey costing almost as much as the TIVO OTA we connected it to, but worth every penny! We cut the cord a couple months ago but CBS was broadcast on VHF and our reception was erratic before this antenna. Make sure to turn off the lower quality repeat channels if you are getting the same channel from different broadcasting towers like we were. It took a few days of trial and error to come up with the best way to face it luckily the TIVO box has a signal quality meter to use for checking each channel.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ANTENNA!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works!!! I recently cut the chord and missed having my local channels, so I bought an antenna on Amazon last week and it only picked up 4 channels, with one of them being horribly choppy. I then bought this antenna and was only 15% into the channel scan when it already had 4 channels show up (the previous antenna mentioned didn't show the 4 channels it received until it was 75% scanned). I now have 24 channels, with 15-20 of them showing in EXCELLENT quality! Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: My wisest purchase yet!
customer_reviews.text: I did my homework before purchasing this antenna, especially with regards to distance of TV towers. I did have to move it around to find the best place to very clearly receive all the channels on my smart TV. Reception is better than cable. I'm really enjoying the quality of reception with this antenna and the cost savings of totally cutting the cord on cable costs. I did not attach the antenna to the wall with the double sided tape. I chose to place it in a window. It is balancing on my window crank and can be moved if I want to move my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L

customer_reviews.title: Incredible reception!
customer_reviews.text: In an attempt to deny the cable company of the ridiculous amount they charge for service, I shut off their TV service and went with this antenna. I expected to be able to watch the basic main network channels and the local PBS. Boy, was I surprised when this flap of plastic in the window found 60, yes 60, channels! Granted a number of them were foreign language stations, but I still have more than enough channels to choose from. There were even channels I had never heard of with cable. The FL-5000 has far exceeded my expectations and I would recommend it to anyone looking to break the cable company's stranglehold on them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor reception with this antenna. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. i tried locating it in every conceivable place, but nothing helped. The few channels it does pick up are unwatchable due to reception errors. Unfortunately to add insult, I waited too long to try it and missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent indoor antenna!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box and found something that appeared to be a square of plastic with a wire coming out, I had my doubts. But this antenna is great! It picks up all my local stations except one, even in the worst weather. The previous antenna was a stand-up model, and it would lose reception if the wind blew too hard! Apart from its reception ability, it is almost completely invisible. It is taped to the wall behind a picture (which doesn't bother it at all), and all that can be seen is a thin white wire going down the wall. I would highly recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: cats&ferrets

customer_reviews.title: As good as they say!
customer_reviews.text: I am buying my 2nd antenna because this works so great!. My rabbit ears antenna was dropping one of the normal local channels, so I finally decided to try something different. The reviews were good - and accurate. I now receive all channels I want even living under a flight path and without the rabbit ears sticking out all over my room. My second antenna will be for the kitchen where there is absolutely no room for anything else. This flat antenna is so thin and lightweight, I stuck it to the wall with regular tape temporarily to scan the channels, but it does come with removable mounting tape.
customer_reviews.author: Clee

customer_reviews.title: Works great...love not having a cable/dish bill!!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using ours for about 10 months now. We live in a Denver suburb and have it installed on an inside wall behind the TV facing east. Overall it works really well and we would recommend it. We get tons of stations and about 15 that we actually watch. When we first got it we moved it around (closer to a window, up higher, etc) and it didn't seem to make a difference either way. Some stations' are hit or miss as to whether their signal comes it or not and it may be weather related - seems we have more lost stations when it storms - but many of the ones we watch are consistently strong.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Antenna to replace cable
customer_reviews.text: Using this antenna, I get to see the stations I formerly watched using cable. With cable prices ever on the increase, this gives an economical way to watch television.
customer_reviews.author: LIZ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Flat Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several Winegard products and find them well made and impressive performers. The FlatWave HDTV Indoor Digital Flat Antenna however didn't perform as I had wished and I've sent it back. My $10 RCA rabbit ears provides a better picture with fewer dropouts at less than 1/3 the cost. Due to a limited kitchen location, I'm allowing for the possibility that location worked against this indoor antenna's performance and am not giving it 1-2 stars. However, for $35 I expected way better. This antenna may be a wonderful performer in a different location.
customer_reviews.author: Neil P.

customer_reviews.title: More channels than I thought I would get
customer_reviews.text: Got more than I thought I would. Turned in two cable boxes and use this antenna. Should have done it sooner
customer_reviews.author: victoria b.

customer_reviews.title: tried it on 2 different tv's with no reception on either
customer_reviews.text: I live 25 miles from 2 major markets and we got no reception, zero. yes we followed the auto channel find directions on 2 different tv's , we actually got more reception just by plugging in the cable cord even though we dont have cable
customer_reviews.author: Mindy A

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it. Cleanly attaches to wall
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it. Cleanly attaches to wall, leaving no marks. Hides behind the tv so you can't see it. But some days the walls prove too much for the antenna and I can't get some channels. Unless, of course, I touch the antenna. Then everything comes in fine...as long as I don't move.
customer_reviews.author: David Knott

customer_reviews.title: this one is awesome and is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: tried a few others, would only pull a few english channels, sent back. this one is awesome and is a keeper. live about 20 miles from city and all the digital ota channels came in crystal clear. The best part this is plug & play, no amplifier required or usb power,very nice.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: This is my fourth try on a good indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: I think we have a winner. I have been impressed with the help you are able to get from Winegard, and this has helped me resolve the issues I kept having with other antennas (including their amplified antenna). Since tv reception on an indoor antenna can vary SO MUCH from one person to the next, I think the fact that you can actually get technical help from Winegard is huge. My antenna attempts have ranged in cost from $60 to $100 (thinking more expensive would be better) and the one that works well for me is this little $30 job. Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the hype...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this after reading the reviews. But, it's really no better than rabbit ears. You have to keep moving it around to get the stations. Or you have to mount it in the middle of the room. Mounting in the window doesn't give you that great reception and I'm not in a rural area. If I had to do over I'd Go for the amplified version.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN RAG

customer_reviews.title: Really?  No, really!
customer_reviews.text: Took this thing out of the box. Looked at it. Looked like a cheap plastic placemat. I thought, "You've GOT to be kidding." Plugged it in to the HD TV and . . . Every single over the air HD channel in Chicago crystal clear, 20 times better than cable. (Speaking of which -- bye-bye cable.) I've tried other HD antennas and they've been . . . okay. Each one missed at least one or two channels, so what was the point? This one, every single over the air HD channel . . . oh, wait, I already said that. Well, it's worth repeating.
customer_reviews.author: RSB56

customer_reviews.title: This is a good Antenna for an amplified array
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with interference from a 4GLTE source so this antenna provided extra boost in the signal i was receiving and i was able to correct and improve my reception.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reception
customer_reviews.text: This HD antenna works great. I receive crystal clear signals on all the regular broadcast channels and a few extra. It is easy to mount thanks to the included command adhesive strips. The best way to mount it is near a window as high up to the ceiling as possible. After mounting, just let your TV auto search for channels. It is that simple. I use this for our second TV in the spare bedroom. The reception and clarity of this antennae is equal to the reception on our Verizon Fios receiver. That is how great it works. The best part about it is, it is free!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: It works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The claims made by the seller are realistic. I did a google search for the local TV stations (San Diego) transmitting antenna locations and expected signal strength prior to purchasing the FL-5000. Hook up was super simple, did a channel scan, and the stations expected were picked up by the antenna (plus a bunch of Mexican stations). Placement of the antenna is important for an optimum picture, so experiment a little if you can. I'm not "raving" about the antenna, just stating it does an adequate job for what the manufacturer / seller claims. :-))
customer_reviews.author: Marvin L. Many

customer_reviews.title: Pulls in NBC from a tower that is about 30 miles away
customer_reviews.text: We could not get NBC with our old HDTV indoor antennas. I purchased this one and it pulled it in crystal clear. We are about 30 miles outside of the towers downtown. Our older digital antennas pull in various stations but seem to struggle holding them. This one seems to hold the signal stronger resulting in less freeze up and i haven't noticed any freeze up so far. We didn't want to put cable in our daughter's bedroom so this is a good solution. Vast improvement over my older antennas that are 3-5 years old each. I'll be replacing all of them with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't pull in any stations no matter where I placed it
customer_reviews.text: I have two tvs I am switching to just antennas. I bought 2 different kinds. This one did not work on either tv no matter where I placed it. I did get reception, but it only lasted 45 seconds. This Winesguard seems so sensitive to where and how to place it, I am going to get a second Antennas Direct Clear Stream.. that is pulling in 34 stations and I found its reception placement "sweet spot" right away.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Scalera

customer_reviews.title: Only one that worked!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried three different types and this is the only one that picked up a majority of the OTA channels.
customer_reviews.author: ZUDE

customer_reviews.title: Not much better than bunny ears but a bit
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, about as good as my previous amplified bunny ears, but there's too much interference in my apartment area. Really the only two advantages are: It looks better and less obtrusive in white, and it has a long chord to so you can improve your signal by location. But still not really any better than rabbit ears. IT's location of the antenna 80% and maybe 20% if it's amp'd or not. Mine is not amped, but it preformed slightly less good (in the same location) as my amp'd bunnies. Because of the long chord, i've now placed it so that it is 5-10% better than the amp'd bunnies.
customer_reviews.author: Excerpt

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting sick and tired of paying for basic cable. I finally decided to cut the cord and buy this. You have to position it right or you won't get the channels. I have over 40 free channels. Best decision ever!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This antenna allowed us to receive programming from some channels in a very rural area, which is nice, but I understand that there are more channels available that we are not able to get with just the antenna. We plan to purchase an additional bootser, which we probably should have done in the first place. The antenna is very easy to set up, the instructions are straightforward, and mounting is very simple. All in all I would call it a good purchase, you will just need to add a booster if you live out in the boonies like we do.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: good bye Cable and Satellite tv
customer_reviews.text: very much surprised by how well it works...good bye Cable and Satellite tv.......!....trends is to get rid of expensive tv bills, this IS the answer.....now that I've had it a while, next I'm going to try an indoor antenna in the attic and see if the reception is better. still this one isn't bad for the money....and of course depends on your location to the towers, the further out you are you may not want to consider this item,,,but near the city it might be perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Shocked at how well these work...
customer_reviews.text: I've been in electronics for well over 30 years now and I was very skeptical when I read the rave reviews for this antenna. I purchased two of them and I couldn't have asked for more for the money. This antenna blows away all of my expectations and more. Picks up channels that the more expensive antenna that I bought doesn't pick up. I would recommend this item to anyone that is looking for an inexpensive solution for over-the-air digital TV reception.
customer_reviews.author: Steele Boenz

customer_reviews.title: Seeing the Dtv that you missed.
customer_reviews.text: The antenna works great. Most channels have 4 bars on a TCL Roku tv. The decision for this antenna versus getting an extender was the radius of the Digital stations, 35 miles(56.33 kilometers). The chord is more than I need, but the added length is good for positioning. Accessories to consider purchasing include addition 3M mounting tabs and zip ties for the extra chord.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Jones

customer_reviews.title: Reception quality better than cable.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to dump cable for a long time, but was put off by my childhood memories of bad reception through an antenna. I bought this to try out and have been amazed at the quality of the reception I'm getting, it's better than cable!. I am able to get 26 out of the 28 over the air channels that are available where I am, I think I could probably get the last two as well if I played around with the antenna position. I'll probably be ordering mores for tvs in other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: TeamFoster

customer_reviews.title: Picks up channels
customer_reviews.text: So far the jury is still out on this because I'm still trying it out on different sides of the house. So far it picks up about 27 channels (only about 10 of which we watch) - we live in Metro NY,NJ,CT area so main broadcast towers are situation in NY. I try and face antenna towards them but on 1st floor of house, only get 27 channels - Ch 2 CBS comes in sporadically. I'm going to try it on second floor rooms to see if we can get more channels. The channels that do come in are broadcast HD which is nice and it's free...what a concept - "Free TV"...Overall so far worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: First indoor that has worked
customer_reviews.text: My house must exist in the Bermuda Triangle of digital signals. I have tried (and still have in a box in a closet) half a dozen indoor antennas, trying to get a consistent signal on at least some of the broadcast channels I care about. None worked until now. This is the first and only indoor antennae that pulls in all but a couple of channels with no signal drop-out, signal break-up or just plain no signal. I've tried others people swore worked and they flat didn't for me, which is to say I think everyone's situation is different; this one worked for me, your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: HDTV antenna saves us lots of money!
customer_reviews.text: We 'cut' the cable and now use only the antenna for live television viewing. It works great! we have a 60" tv and the resolution is as good as cable. By stoping cable TV and our landline phone, we dropped our monthly bill from $190 to $35 for internet only. Now we pretty much just pick out the 'channels' we want via our roku. If you live in an urban area where there is over air broadcast I strongly recommend using an antenna to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McManus

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap. It works. I mean it REALLY works.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in, scanned for channels, and within a couple minutes I was watching CRYSTAL CLEAR HD television. I had just purchased the LG Electronics 42LN5700 42-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV and I refuse to spend another $60-80 a month on cable so I just used it for the built in apps (Netflix, YouTube, etc.) Then I wanted to watch a football game and I couldn't so I knew it was time to try a digital antenna. The reviews convinced me and I couldn't be happier. I get a couple dozen channels including all the networks.
customer_reviews.author: stvgrc

customer_reviews.title: No More Cable Bills!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a terribly small town in northern MN. I was pretty skeptical about the number and clarity of channels I'd get with this but couldn't take the plunge into another contract with the cable company. I was delightfully surprised with the Winegard antenna. It works really well (I get 11 channels - which is about 11 more than I thought I'd get) and the set up was almost nonexistent. I also purchased an amplified version of this but don't get any additional channels with that model. I'd recommend saving some cash and purchasing this antenna first. I haven't had any troubles so far - and I'm saving tons of money sans cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia U

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna
customer_reviews.text: I bought is because although I don't live in a rural area, I do live in an area surrounded by very tall trees, hello North Carolina. And I'm near the airport so I have planes zooming by every other minute. That being said I still get about 20 channels with it. However, I am going to buy the Boost Amplifier also made by Winegard just because it should help with the tree and planes situation. It's really annoying watching a prime time show and have it cut out for a minute because a plane is in my path (it only does this on ABC, all other channels okay)! So hopefully the amplifier will work.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Surprising
customer_reviews.text: So thin, nice long cable, and picks up about 40 channels in my area (Washington DC, Capitol Hill neighborhood). Now, I'm on the 11th floor of an apartment building, so I was expecting decent reception, but I'm on the wrong side, facing away from the stations. Nonetheless, with the antenna in the window (behind my blinds so I can't even see it), they all come in crystal clear. BTW, the "easy install patches" are just 3M Command Strips, available almost anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing reception and clarity
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this thin antenna works so well. We live about 30 miles from most of the broadcast towers, and I'm able to pull in several VHF and UHF stations, and they are SUPER clear HD. We can now get over the air ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX, and several others. You have to try out different orientations and directions, right now it is flat and pointed NE a bit. I am hoping to possibly cut down the cable pkg to just internet and cheap phone, and then supplement with Hulu/Netflix and this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: So, we are living in Manhattan and were sceptic (tried 2 other antenna's). We placed it on a first floor window facing South East. And we have very good reception on a large number of channels. Its sometimes a little break up here and there but not too annoying (at least not as annoying as all the commercials on TV). But it seems to be a game of trail and error. I loaned it to my friend, who lives 7 stories high, 40 blocks south of me. He faced it NE, and had very bad reception. Anyway, we are very happy with this antenna and its the best one of the ones we tried.
customer_reviews.author: mark van der linden

customer_reviews.title: Works well and does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I am picking up all kinds of channels now . Not much to say as antenna technology has not changed much... No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: buzzsawddog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is great. I checked website antennaweb.org and it showed no stations in my rural area but I bought the antenna anyway. First time I hooked it up I got 16 clear channels. I even got 4 new ones I can’t get with cable. I got the antenna for those times when the cable is out, which happens often. Last time it was out for 5 hours. This will give me access to the news and weather channels since the cable usually goes out during a storm. I’m very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Navarre

customer_reviews.title: No more cable bills!
customer_reviews.text: For years, my husband and I have been circling the debate of whether or not to cancel our basic cable. After getting a thorough runaround from the cable company following the switch to HD, we'd had enough and decided to just get rid of it altogether. The antenna is very easy to install and we get more channels than we did with basic cable. We did lose access to the Discovery Channel, but gained a few extra Public Broadcasting and "oldies" channels. It's worth noting that we do lose reception if it's storming heavily outside. However, I am overall very pleased. We even bought a mini antenna for the kitchen television.
customer_reviews.author: tommitoes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I get about 1/2 the local channels in my area with this antenna. I believe if I got the one with the booster I would get all the local channels. Most stations come in clear. ~60 stations, but really about ~20 of them that are in english and usable.
customer_reviews.author: RealDeal

customer_reviews.title: best antenna out there (in my area at least)
customer_reviews.text: This antenna has provided better reception clarity and more channels than all others I've tried, even those external fancy antennas. It looks like a flimsy piece of plastic, and when you unbox it you will think you were ripped off, but give it a shot and place it somewhere above eye-level or higher. It works very well. For my area it even beat out the clearstream2 for VHF reception (UHF was slightly better on the clearstream than the winegard). I receive 62 channels right now with this antenna, all for free of course.
customer_reviews.author: A Ben out there

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other - Matawan Central NJ
customer_reviews.text: Better than any rabbit ear type that I tried. Could pick up only 5 or 6 channels with rabbit ear even though I scoured the forums to get recommendations for them. This picks up 2 4 5 7 9 11 13 23 25 31 36 41 47 50 58 63 68 and their various sub channels if it is in the front of the house. Attached to a TV in the back of the house, I have to move it around to get good reception on all of those channels. Placement seems to be everything. Some of the stations in the back of the house come in when I lay it flat on the floor. I am in Matawan NJ.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schuller

customer_reviews.title: Nice low-profile design but only works when close to cities
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these knowing full well that they may not work since we lived 70 miles from Chicago. And sure enough, I was lucky to pick up more than 2 channels: one of which was the local PBS channel 30 miles away and I could barely make out CBS. A lot depends on how you mount the thing. Mounting in the window yielded the best result but even being able to turn/bow it at the window netted better results. Not a bad product, but keep in mind that if you really live in the sticks, you may not get many, if any, channels!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easy!
customer_reviews.text: It's good to watch a news without signing to any program and it just one time payment, and you set for a long time. Only I should buy an antenna for more radius to catch up more channels - with this not to many channels and quality so-so.
customer_reviews.author: Lyudmila

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Signal, No Need to Move Around
customer_reviews.text: I placed the antenna in my attic and plugged it into my main cable line coming into the house. My first placement worked perfectly and I am receiving an excellent signal on all local channels in crystal clear HD. I did not even have to use an amplifier. It is currently feeding two tvs, one upstairs near the antenna and one downstairs with no loss of signal. It is extremely thin and could easily be placed behind a tv, on a wall, or on a window. Take that cable company!
customer_reviews.author: stradavarius

customer_reviews.title: Probably needs an amplifier...
customer_reviews.text: Now I live in a tiny town probably 30-ish miles away from the closest broadcast stations so I was only able to pick up 3 channels with this indoor antenna (and even then they were kinda "glitchy"). Very easy to set up though. I'd like to get an amplifier to see if it helps bring in more channels.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Can't Use This
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my son a TV for Christmas, which was too big. So, I returned it to Amazon and purchased a different TV from Amazon. Well, this antenna won't work with this TV. Am I able to return it? Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: S. Henke

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in L.A. area
customer_reviews.text: I am now getting clear HDTV for free! No more cable or satellite fees. I now get all the major broadcast stations in HD, and a bunch of local and specialty channels, along with a plethora of PBS. I love PBS! It's extremely easy to install. Just plug it in, affix it to the wall with the provided sticky tape and scan for channels. It's pretty unobtrusive looking. It looks kind of like a giant T.E.N.S. unit electrode. I'm tempted to cut those letters with my Sizzix Eclips and stick them on it for a laugh.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kono

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product does a good job of tuning in the local channels. It is a bit tricky to find the best spot to mount it to get the best reception, but once you find it, all stations a very clear. Only once an a great while do I get some pixelation. It even works well in our basement (pixelation here is more frequent - like once every hour on average) although not as well as the main floors, but I would guess that is to be expected. The slim coaxial cable is plenty long, allowing for the most flexibility in placement. Easy out-of-the-box installation, just follow your TV's menu to scan, find and tune the stations.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Dont get your hopes up
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple RCA digital antenna's from best buy that I didnt do any reseach on prior to purchasing and they seem to work decently. I did do research before buying these Winegard antenna's and started getting my hopes up that I should get better reception than the RCA ones I have... NOPE all 4 of my antenna's work about the same. They all take some fine adjusting to get most of the channels in the area. If I had to do again I would of saved the $10 each and bought 2 more from best buy.
customer_reviews.author: Evolrider

customer_reviews.title: Good Antenna!
customer_reviews.text: Living just outside of Philadelphia, we're close to many broadcasting stations. When I set up this antenna, I was surprised to find that it was able to locate 60 channels in the area. Set up is easy and quick. The channel scan was what took the longest time. I would recommend this to others looking to get rid of cable and get free over the air TV. The reception is clear. I also purchased another, smaller antenna (different brand) to try both and the FlatWave is superior. More channels and better picture.
customer_reviews.author: cjcregg227

customer_reviews.title: why didn't i do this sooner
customer_reviews.text: i have 28 channels, live in virginia beach. channels are clearer than cable. both cox and verizon. i also have the roku with amazon prime. so i cancelled my cable bill, saved me $100 a month. the roku just wasn't able to get local channels like news and pbs. this seriously solved that issue. I am so happy i bought this. minus one star because it was suppose to come with something to help hang it, atleast it said so in the instructions but it wasn't there. it blends easily on the wall definately try it out. i was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Lilmama

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: See my review of the Amazon Basics High Performance antenna (basically this exact same antenna rebranded). Got this for our downstairs TV and it pulls in essentially every single channel and we live approx 25 miles away from the towers. Not as great as our other antenna, but that one is upstairs so a lot higher up with less obstructions. Best thing about this and the Amazon antenna is the 15 foot long cord really lets you find the right position for it. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Historyf24

customer_reviews.title: Superior antenna.
customer_reviews.text: Canceled my satellite subscription. This brings in all local channels quite well in the suburban Springfield, MO area, except for PBS, which cuts in and out. If I moved the antenna a bit, I may be able to get PBS better, but have not yet tried it. It was simple to install and blends in with my light colored tan walls - no one even notices it.
customer_reviews.author: p j lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Works great & easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Set up took 5 minutes and it picked up all the main local channels (we are less than 40 miles from the furthest tower)
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: Unobtrusive performance
customer_reviews.text: I will preface this by saying I am located within a few miles of most of the station antennas that I watch -- your mileage may vary. This works better than the bunny ears I started with. Make sure you try lots of positions (use tape to hold it temporarily). I found I get better reception with the antenna on the wall behind the TV than I did with it installed in either adjacent window. The antenna comes with the removable mounting tape (3M Command), so no need to buy it separately.
customer_reviews.author: MachNone

customer_reviews.title: Worked as promised
customer_reviews.text: We use the antenna for a tv on the second floor to good results. We get almost all the locals and are pleased with the picture quality. The local broadcast antenna is across town and about 30 miles in distance, so the results are better than expected. We tried the unit on our first floor tv and picked up only 8 channels, so location of the broadcaster, tv and antenna all play a role. We are going to try a powered unit for the first floor tv. Keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for cord cutters!
customer_reviews.text: Recently dumped our FiOS tv and use Roku, but NFL season is approaching. I'm about 18 miles from the local TV stations. This was easy to install and pulled in 38 crisp stations. Besides my goal of receiving NBC, CBS, ABC and Fox, even got some more obscure stations that I'm liking too. For the price, this was a great investment. Made cutting the cord less traumatic.
customer_reviews.author: Dot D.

customer_reviews.title: Compare to Mohu Leaf 30
customer_reviews.text: I live in South Jersey 17 miles from Philadelphia broadcast towers. The Mohu Leaf 30 provided much better signal, so I returned the Winegard antenna. I attached the antenna to the window using suction cups, and for most channels can hide the antenna behind the TV. For a better signal (meaning no pixelating), on a couple channels I temporarily move the antenna higher on the window, then move it back down for better aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Lainey B

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We tried it both in our home in Seattle, WA and Tucson, AZ. It picked up a bunch of stations at both locations. In Seattle, we did not even bother to try to place it in a window - just set it flat on top of the entertainment cart below the TV. The quality of the HD picture on the channels received was great. As good or better than our HDTV cable service.
customer_reviews.author: AugsburgTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended this for me and I am very pleased with this product. I was a little skeptical at first but after we placed it in the window and I saw the reception I was hooked! After recommending this to me my son also purchased one as well and is very happy with the clarity. I would highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Smith

customer_reviews.title: I am sorry to say that this product did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry to say that this product did not work as well as the rabbit ears and UHF indoor antenna that is sitting out in the rhododendron bush in the front yard. It didn't matter where it was placed or what height it was lifted to. Even when I brought it outside and tested it, the signal was weaker. A couple of friends on Facebook linked me to some DIY projects that are much cheaper. I will probably try one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna.  Great bang for buck.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive. I had a different more off-brand antenna ordered from here on Amazon in the location, and switching to this Winegard antenna resulted in a significant improvement in reception and consistency. I rarely have any issues at all now and channels are consistently clear and without any interruptions. Impressive stuff. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I looked for highly rated, inexpensive antennae and this one fit the bill. However, it;s big, ugly and a guitar string stuck into my coaxial hole picks up just as many channels. We even have a station less than a mile away and it won't pick up that station.
customer_reviews.author: Natroneous

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: The antenna pulled in a good number of tv stations. Unfortunately it could not receive the local ABC station which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Mieses

customer_reviews.title: 2nd review
customer_reviews.text: I have this for a week now, my needs are not more channels, just want better quality channels, my channel 2 (real channel 12 VHF), wasn't coming in solid, after I added a piece of aluminum foil as reflector (4" behind), now comes in solid. I am 46 miles form Chicago, and the antenna is inside behind a wall and the roof (asphalt)in the second floor, also covered with snow, and I get all the major networks solid and clear on HD. I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: csan

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed! Fantastic results! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just amazing! I was paying Time Warner $50 per month for basic tv just so that I could have the networks. This little antenna gives me perfect HD channels for free and I get even more channels than before. I am amazed at how sharp the picture is! I live on a lake in Idaho. I stuck this to the wall INDOORS and was so impressed that I immediately cancelled T.W. basic cable. Buy it, you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: PRSPlayer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Yet using it and not a Problem up to now
customer_reviews.author: Zeneide

customer_reviews.title: Great item and love the savings of no cable bill
customer_reviews.text: After pulling the plug on cable - I knew I would still need a little TV. A neighbor recommended this brand and I ordered that day. Easy breezy installation - must say run the scan a few times while adjusting placement of antenna. Quality of picture is WOW better than Cable. I was able to get NBC CBS ABC PBS CW FOX and a few other station i never heard of. Recommend this for anyone wanting to cut the cable cord but who knows they will still need a fix.
customer_reviews.author: D. Korosi

customer_reviews.title: Excited to Unshackle
customer_reviews.text: I get over 15 HD quality stations including the local ABC, NBC, CBS, Fox, and PBS. This product unshackles me from Time Warner. With netflix, amazon prime, and Hulu, there's so little reason to spend $1500 a year on that junk. This doesn't require any monthly service fees, unpredictable billing, or awful customer service. Head directly to the checkout cart because this product will make you very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Freemaev

product_meta.title: Winegard FL-5000 FlatWave Digital Indoor HDTV Antenna (4K Ready / High-VHF / UHF / Ultra-Thin), 35 Mile Long Range
product_meta.description:
Style:FlatWaveWinegard FL-5000 FlatWave Digital HD Indoor TV Antenna: 

Watch local news, weather, live sports and all of the top-rated shows for free, in HD, and with Dolby Digital Surround Sound with the FlatWave indoor digital TV antenna.

Cut the cord and save! The average home pays over $750 for cable in just one year. Did you know the average household receives 189 Tv channels with cable, but uses only 17 of them? Watch the TV you want without the big monthly TV bill. Cut the cord and watch the top-rated TV shows for free!

Tech Specs
- Indoor antenna range: 35 mile range
- HD dual band VHF and High-UHF TV antenna
- Multi-directional TV antenna
- Ultra-thin, 0.6lb weight
- Digital TV antenna dimensions: 13" x 12"

In The Box
- FlatWave FL-5000 non-amplified indoor TV antenna
- 15' mini coax cable attached to antenna
- Two 3M Command brand strips

Warranty and Support
- One year limited warranty
- Complimentary telephone and email support
- Online technical manuals, instructions and videos

Note: Run a channel scan after installation To receive programming run a channel scan on your TV after setting up the indoor antenna. To keep your channel line-up up-to-date, it is a good idea to run a channel scan monthly and anytime a channel is lost.
feature_bullets: Winegard's best performing indoor antenna with a 35-mile range
No assembly required; just connect it to the back of your TV, run a channel scan and in minutes you'll be enjoying all of your favorite shows, sports, and news live and in HD
Extra long coaxial cable (15') included so you can position the FlatWave in the strongest signal areas
Ultra thin dual color design blends into any surrounding
Made in the U.S.A. by Winegard Company, the leader in antenna design and manufacturing for nearly 60 years

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,605 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
